fullText: The show has energy and spectacle to spare, but it struggles to find its own distinct voice amid the familiar Kander and Ebb songbook.
dtliExcerpt: The show has energy and spectacle to spare, but it struggles to find its own distinct voice amid the familiar Kander and Ebb songbook.
bwwExcerpt: New York, New York is an affection project: a loving group tribute, with 40 producers above the title, to the 96-year-old Kander, one of Broadway’s most beloved creators. It’s an excuse for a big, old-fashioned dance on not-quite-finished materials. And thanks to the elements of it that do shine—the craftsmanship of the score, the wrought-iron fire escapes of Beowulf Boritt’s set, the splendid variety of Donna Zakowska’s costumes, the command of Uzele’s vocals, the infectious energy of the produ
